data.name: index_eversion
data.value: Your sendmail config file does not appear to be for the latest sendmail version. Webmin only supports versions 8.8 and above.

data.name: index_stopmsg
data.value: Click this button to stop the running sendmail process. This will stop mail from being delivered to local users from other systems, and prevent clients using this system as a mail server from sending mail.

data.name: index_startmsg
data.value: Click this button to start sendmail with the command $1. Until this is done mail will not be delivered to local users from other systems, and clients will not be able to use this system as a mail server.

data.name: opts_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit sendmail options

data.name: opts_dh
data.value: Forward mail for local users to host

data.name: opts_ehost
data.value: '$1' is not a valid host or domain name

data.name: opts_einvalid
data.value: '$1' is not a valid value for '$2'

data.name: opts_gecos
data.value: Accept mail for users' real names?

data.name: aliases_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit aliases

data.name: aliases_enofile
data.value: No aliases file is defined in your Sendmail configuration

data.name: aliases_toomany
data.value: There are too many mail aliases on your system to display on this page.

data.name: aform_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit this alias

data.name: afile_desc
data.value: Use the text area below to edit the addresses in the file $1.

data.name: afile_efile
data.value: You are not allowed to edit $1.

data.name: afile_ewrite
data.value: Failed to write to addresses file : $1

data.name: ffile_desc
data.value: Use the form below to setup filter rules in the file $1.

data.name: ffile_efile
data.value: You are not allowed to edit $1.

data.name: ffile_line
data.value: If the $1 field $2 $3 then forward to $4

data.name: rfile_desc
data.value: Use the text area below to edit the autoreply message in $1. The message may contain the macros $SUBJECT, $FROM, $TO, $DATE and $BODY which will be expanded when the autoreply is activated.

data.name: rfile_desc2
data.value:
You can also set mail headers that add to or replace the defaults used in the autoreply by putting lines like:
From: foo@bar.com
Subject: On holiday
at the top of the message, separated from the body by a single blank line.

data.name: rfile_efile
data.value: You are not allowed to edit $1.

data.name: rfile_replies
data.value: Track replies to prevent mail loops?

data.name: rfile_eperiod
data.value: Missing or invalid number of seconds between replies

data.name: rfile_no_regexp
data.value: Don't send autoreplies to messages matching regexps

data.name: rfile_fromdesc
data.value: A From: address should always be specified where possible, as the automatic method may not be reliable.

data.value: You are not allowed to edit aliases

data.value: You are not allowed to edit this alias

data.value: You are only allowed to create aliases matching '$1'

data.name: asave_etype
data.value: You cannot create aliases of this type

data.value: '$1' is not a valid email address

data.value: Addresses file '$1' is not valid or does not exist

data.value: You are only allowed to create an alias with the same name as your webmin login

data.name: adelete_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to delete the alias $1

data.name: cws_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit local domains

data.name: cws_desc1
data.value: Apart from mail to $1, sendmail will only accept for local delivery mail for domains and hostnames listed in the text box below. If you want your mail server to handle multiple email domains, they must all be listed on this form.

data.name: cws_desc2
data.value: Note that merely including a domain in the list is not usually enough. You must also make sure that a DNS record for the domain exists, and points to your system.

data.name: cws_ehost
data.value: '$1' is not a valid host or domain name

data.name: cws_eip
data.value: '$1' is an IP address, not a domain

data.name: masq_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure masquerading

data.name: masq_desc2
data.value: This feature can be useful if you want email from your system to appear to come from your domain name rather than your hostname, or if your system is the mail hub for number of other hosts running their own mailservers.

data.name: masq_edomain
data.value: '$1' is not a valid domain to masquerade as

data.name: masq_ehost
data.value: '$1' is not a valid host or domain name

data.name: masq_eip
data.value: '$1' is an IP address, not a domain

data.name: trusts_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit trusted users

data.name: trusts_desc
data.value: If a local user tries to send email, sendmail will only allow the user to provide a different <tt>From:</tt> address if the user is on the list below. This restriction exists to prevent users from forging email with faked <tt>From:</tt> addresses origination from your system.

data.name: mailers_cannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain routing

data.name: mailers_edirective
data.value: Your sendmail configuration file does not have the necessary directive for domain routing.

data.name: mailers_desc1
data.value: Domain routing provides a way to define a special transfer method for mail to certain domains. This can be useful if your system is a gateway for mail servers that cannot be reached from outside your network, or if you want to force all mail for a particular domain to be routed through some other server.

data.name: mform_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain routing

data.name: msave_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain routing

data.name: msave_edomain
data.value: '$1' is not a valid host or domain

data.name: msave_edup
data.value: Domain routing for '$1' is already defined

data.name: mdelete_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to delete the route for $1

data.name: generics_cannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit outgoing addresses

data.name: generics_econfig
data.value: Your sendmail configuration file does not have the necessary directive for outgoing address mapping.

data.name: generics_desc1
data.value: Outgoing address mapping allows you to modify the <tt>From:</tt> addresses of mail send out from your system, or through your system by other hosts on your local network. This can be useful if you are hosting multiple domains on the one system, and want mail from some users to appear to come from a different domain.

data.name: generics_toomany
data.value: There are too many outgoing addresses on your system to display on this page.

data.name: domains_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain mapping

data.name: domains_econfig
data.value: Your sendmail configuration file does not have the necessary directive for domain mapping.

data.name: domains_desc
data.value: Domain mapping modifies the <tt>To:</tt> address of messages sent out from, relayed through or delivered to users on your system. The <tt>From:</tt> address of relayed messages or messages to local users is also modified. This can be useful if your domain name changes, and you want to change all occurrances of the old domain to the new one.

data.name: dform_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain mapping

data.name: dsave_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit domain mapping

data.name: dsave_edomain
data.value: '$1' is not a valid domain name

data.name: dsave_ealready
data.value: A domain mapping for '$1' already exists

data.name: ddelete_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to delete the mapping for $1

data.name: access_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to configure spam control

data.name: access_desc1
data.value: Sendmail's spam control feature allows you to prevent spam from reaching your users by rejecting mail from certain addresses, and to prevent spammers from using your system to relay mail. By default sendmail will accept mail from any address for a local user, but prevent any client or mail server from relaying mail through your system. Typically you would add spam control rules to reject mail from spammers, and rules to allow other machines on your network to relay mail through your system.

data.name: access_desc2
data.value: Note that sendmail will by default allow mail clients running on your system to relay mail via SMTP to any destination. Thus there is no need to add the local <tt>127.0.0</tt> network to the list of those allowed to relay.

data.name: access_toomany
data.value: There are too many spam control rules on your system to display on this page.

data.name: sform_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to edit this spam control rule

data.name: ssave_ealready
data.value: A spam control rule for '$1' already exists

data.name: ssave_ecannot2
data.value: You are not allowed to save this spam control rule

data.name: sdelete_err
data.value: Failed to delete spam control rules

data.name: mailq_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to view the mail queue

data.name: mailq_dmsg
data.value: To view a message from the mail queue, click on its ID in the list above.

data.name: mailq_none
data.value: No mail messages are currently queued for delivery

data.name: mailq_flushdesc
data.value: Click this button to force the immediate delivery of all messages in the queue, and display the results.

data.name: mailq_flushquardesc
data.value: Click this button to force the delivery of only quarantined messages in the queue.

data.name: mailq_refreshdesc
data.value: Reload this page to show the current state of the mail queue.

data.name: flushq_desc
data.value: Forcing the attempted delivery of all messages with the command $1 ..

data.name: flushq_desc2
data.value: Forcing the attempted delivery of $1 selected messages ..

data.name: flushq_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to flush the mail queue

data.name: delq_ecannot
data.value: You are not allowed to dequeue messages

data.name: delq_locked
data.value: File is currently locked for sending

data.name: delq_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the $1 selected queued messages?

data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the $1 selected messages from $2? This may take some time for a large mail file. Until the deletion has finished, no other action should be performed.

data.value: Are you sure you want to delete this message from $1? This may take some time for a large mail file. Until the deletion has finished, no other action should be performed.

data.name: features_desc
data.value: This page lists the relevant entries from the Sendmail M4 configuration file $1, from which the actual configuration file $2 is built.

data.name: features_buildmsg
data.value: Click this button to rebuild your Sendmail configuration file $1 from the M4 configuration entries listed above.

data.name: feature_eostype
data.value: The OS type is already defined as $1

data.name: feature_mdesc
data.value: The page allowes you to manually edit the Sendmail M4 configuration file $1. Be careful, as no syntax checking will be done on your edits.

data.name: build_em4
data.value: The command $1 needed for rebuilding the Sendmail configuration file was not found on your system.

data.name: build_rusure
data.value: Are you sure you want to replace the Sendmail configuration file $1 with a new version built from $2 ?

data.name: build_rusure2
data.value: Be aware that if you have made changes to Sendmail in the Sendmail Options page, rebuilding the config file may overwrite those changes if they have not also been made in the M4 file.

data.name: build_diff
data.value: The following changes will be made to your Sendmail configuration file ..

data.name: build_nodiff
data.value: Your sendmail configuration file is already up to date.
